questions.question: The observations X,...,Xn have a mean of 52, a median 52.1, and a standard deviation of 7. Eight percent of the observation are greater than 66%; 7.9% of the observations are below 38. Based on this information, which of the following statements best describes the data ?

answers.d: The distribution conforms to a normal distribution

questions.question: In a week the prices of a bag of rice were 350, 280, 340, 290, 320, 310, 300. The range is?
The mean of 10 observations is 10. All observations are increased by 10%. The mean of the increased observations shall be?

explanations.a: When the observations are increased by 10%, the mean increases by 10%. The mean = 10, The mean increased by 10% of 10 = 10*10/100 = 1. Therefore, the mean of increased observation shall be 11
explanations.b: When the observations are increased by 10%, the mean increases by 10%. The mean = 10, The mean increased by 10% of 10 = 10*10/100 = 1. Therefore, the mean of increased observation shall be 11
explanations.c: When the observations are increased by 10%, the mean increases by 10%. The mean = 10, The mean increased by 10% of 10 = 10*10/100 = 1. Therefore, the mean of increased observation shall be 11
explanations.d: When the observations are increased by 10%, the mean increases by 10%. The mean = 10, The mean increased by 10% of 10 = 10*10/100 = 1. Therefore, the mean of increased observation shall be 11

questions.question: If the mean (x) is 4 and the data points are 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6, what will be the sum of the squared deviations from the mean (x)?

explanations.a: The sum of the squared deviations from the mean(X)= Sum_{1}^{n}[(Xi-mean(X))^2] = 10
explanations.b: The sum of the squared deviations from the mean(X)= Sum_{1}^{n}[(Xi-mean(X))^2] = 10
explanations.c: The sum of the squared deviations from the mean(X)= Sum_{1}^{n}[(Xi-mean(X))^2] = 10
explanations.d: The sum of the squared deviations from the mean(X)= Sum_{1}^{n}[(Xi-mean(X))^2] = 10
